metadata

Class PatternEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • metadata.PatternEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PatternLoader

    public class PatternEditor
extends java.lang.Object
implements PatternLoader
    This class contains all the graphical and logical methods for the Pattern Editor functionality. Giving the user the appertunity to edit patterns and watch the future generations at the editors generation strip(genPane). The patterns can be edited using eighter loaded patterns, or my mouse interaction with the canvas. It has a save pattern and save GIF feature, that lets the user save the pattern to eighter a RLE file or a GIF file.

        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the FXMLLoader fails.

      • fetchDynamicValues

        public void fetchDynamicValues()
        Setting essential values from dynamicBoard. Putting them in to the StaticBoard object. CurrentGen(see link), CellSize, and Living cell color is set. Calling setDefaultPaintingColors.
        See Also:
        GenerationConcurrHash.convertToStatic()

      • createInitPattern

        public void createInitPattern()
        Engages a initPattern creation at initiation. If a generation with values exists in the StaticBoard's current generation(currentGen) it will create a initPattern based on that if it dosnt exist a pattern size dialog(initPatternSizeDialog) will show. Allowing the user to pick the desiered sizes of the initPattern.
        See Also:
        createDeadBorder(byte[][]), initPatternSizeDialog()

      • initPatternSizeDialog

        public void initPatternSizeDialog()
        PatternSizeDialog allows the user to set the width and height variables of this instance. Letting us create a new initPattern with the choosen sizes.
        See Also:
        PatternSizeDialog

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Drawing on the main canvas. Updating drawOffset, makeing the initPattern appear in the middle of the canvas. Using the user choosen colors, from the living(JavaFX ColorPicker) color. And initiates engageDrawStrip.
        See Also:
        drawOffset(), engageDrawStrip(boolean)

      • drawOffset

        public void drawOffset()
        Drawoffset makes sure that the initPattern is always sentered in the middle of the main canvas(editorCanvas).

      • engageDrawStrip

        public void engageDrawStrip(boolean engage)
        Initiates drawStrip() if the boolean parameter entered is true.
        Parameters:
        engage - if engage is true, drawStrip() will engage.
        See Also:
        drawStrip()

      • drawStrip

        public void drawStrip()
        Drawing a strip on the genCanvas, using a JavaFX GraphicsContext instance(strip). User can choose the color to be drawn with, by a JavaFX Colorpicker in the GUI. It starts its sequence by calculating and setting the canvas width, based on the future generation. It then starts the draw sequence, by first to check if the stripPattern is not empty, if it is it will return, and end the cycle. Then a dead border will be attached to the stripPattern, if nessesary. And a calculation for the stripCellSize will happend, and the stripCellSize will be set. A next generation calculation through calcNextGen in NextGeneration class, in package logic is runned, the pattern will be checked if it is equal to the initPattern, cycle will end if it is. And that continues for stripFrames-1 generations, if the patternEqualityCheck dosnt trigger.
        See Also:
        calcCanvasWidth(double), patternNotEmpty(byte[][]), deadBorderControl(byte[][]), calcStripCellSize(byte[][]), NextGeneration.calcNextGen(byte[][]), patternEqualityCheck(byte[][])

      • patternEqualityCheck

        public boolean patternEqualityCheck(byte[][] input)
        Testing if a pattern is equal to the initPattern.
        Parameters:
        input - input being tested at the initPattern
        Returns:
        true if the parameter is identical to initPattern, returns false if it is not.

      • deadBorderControl

        public byte[][] deadBorderControl(byte[][] input)
        Makes sure that there is always a singel field dead border around the input pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - to be tested and modified.
        Returns:
        modified with a dead border if modification was nessesary.
        See Also:
        expandPattern(byte[][]), shrinkPattern(byte[][])

      • expandPattern

        public byte[][] expandPattern(byte[][] input)
        Expands GIF/strip pattern. Expands the GIF/strip pattern if nessesary. To make sure that it is always a dead cell border around the pattern. Testing if the pattern needs to be expanded to obtain a dead border around it
        Parameters:
        input - is the pattern to be checked and dead bordered.
        Returns:
        returns the dead bordered pattern.
        See Also:
        createDeadBorder(byte[][])

      • shrinkPattern

        public byte[][] shrinkPattern(byte[][] input)
        Shrinks the GIF/strip pattern. To make sure that it is only one dead cell border around the GIF/strip pattern. Testing if the pattern needs to be shrinked, to obtain a singel dead border field around it.
        Parameters:
        input - is the pattern to be checked and dead bordered.
        Returns:
        returns the dead bordered pattern.
        See Also:
        createDeadBorder(byte[][])

      • createDeadBorder

        public byte[][] createDeadBorder(byte[][] input)
        Trimming initiation pattern, and creating a dead border around the pattern. If no pattern was detected, it will display pattern size dialog to the user, letting the user create his/her own empty pattern. Uses the boundingBox method of the staticBoard class, shrinking the input pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - is a byte[][] pattern that is going to be trim.
        Returns:
        the trimmed byte[][] pattern

      • patternNotEmpty

        public boolean patternNotEmpty(byte[][] input)
        Checks if the pattern just contains zeros by iterating through it and adding all the 1 values to a sum.
        Parameters:
        input - is the input byte[][] pattern to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the pattern is not empty, false if the pattern is empty.

      • changeCellStatusClicked

        public void changeCellStatusClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Changing cell status by mouse clicks on canvas. Using the offsetX and offsetY variables to calculate where to change status. Returns if the mouse click happend outside the initPattern. If the cell was live it will die and wise versa.
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent on PatternEditor canvas.

      • changeCellStatusDragged

        public void changeCellStatusDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Changing cell status by mouse click and drag on canvas. Using the offsetX and offsetY variables to calculate where to change status. Returns if the mouse drag happend outside the initPattern. If primary button press, cells will be live. If secondary button press cells will die.
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent on PatternEditor canvas.

        Parameters:

      • setStartIndexLoaded

        public void setStartIndexLoaded()
        Setter for start index to loaded pattern. This is where the pattern placement sequence starts. It is set to start at the middle of the current generation (currentGen) pattern.
        Specified by:
        setStartIndexLoaded in interface PatternLoader
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.setStartIndexLoaded()

      • moveLoaded

        public void moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
        Allows the user to move the loaded pattern, and place it desierably. key S: moves down key W: moves up key D: moves right key A: moves left key E: rotates key CONTROL: glue pattern key ESCAPE: escapes pattern placement.
        Specified by:
        moveLoaded in interface PatternLoader
        Parameters:
        e - e KeyEvent allowing user input from keyboard.
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent)

      • drawLoaded

        public void drawLoaded()
        Draws the pattern loaded in by user, either through URL or as a RLE file. Uses 2D representation to load pattern. Every living cell is set to grey and every dead cell is transparent.
        Specified by:
        drawLoaded in interface PatternLoader
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.drawLoaded()

      • calcCanvasWidth

        public double calcCanvasWidth(double padding)
        Calculates canvas width. Based on a simple stripPattern generation and stripCellSize calculation.
        Parameters:
        padding - padding is the padding between strip generations.
        Returns:
        sum sum is the calculated sum to the genCanvas width.
